title: Unidentified entries at Fonts In Use
content: Calling all IDers! We are now tagging the [entries at Fonts In Use that lack a positive typeface ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/fontsinuse.com/typefaces/7251/unidentified-typeface). If you know any of these, I would most grateful for your help. Post comments on the site or replies here. Thanks, pals!
author: Stephen Coles

comments.content:
I posted a comment on this:  
 [http://fontsinuse.com/uses/2480/haallbarshop](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/2480/haallbarshop "http://fontsinuse.com/uses/2480/haallbarshop")

The serif looks like [Publico](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/publico).

[The logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/3234/makers-brothers) reminds me of [Glaser Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/www.identifont.com/show?6VV). Some of the letters are similar.

Lieutenant Pigeon – Mouldy Old Dough  
 [http://fontsinuse.com/uses/232/lieutenant-pigeon-mouldy-old-dough](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/232/lieutenant-pigeon-mouldy-old-dough "http://fontsinuse.com/uses/232/lieutenant-pigeon-mouldy-old-dough")

Lieutenant Pigeon: very close to [Aeronaut](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/facetype/aeronaut) so may be (quoted from MF description) "Kirchengotische Schrift, a font that can be found in a German font book from 1879 entitled Vorlegeblätter für Firmenschreiber."  
MOULDY OLD DOUGH: a gothic concave tuscan should do the job from [Concave Tuscan](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/concave-tuscan) (Shade version unshaded would probably the closest I have), [Gothic Tuscan](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/gothic-tuscan), [Minnesota](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/minnesota), [Mansard](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/mansard)

[http://fontsinuse.com/uses/212/wild-life-jazz-band-swinging-dixieland-ev...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/212/wild-life-jazz-band-swinging-dixieland-evergr "http://fontsinuse.com/uses/212/wild-life-jazz-band-swinging-dixieland-evergr")

The western font looks like (or shares characteristics of) a non-condensed version of [HFF Young Wanna](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415073627/http:/www.dafont.com/hff-young-wanna.font?text=WILD+LIFE+JAZZ+BAND&fpp=500&af=on) which was derived from Juanita on page 50 of the Solotype catalogue »Condensed Alphabets: 100 Complete Fonts« or  
page 37 of »The Solotype Catalog of 4,147 Display Typefaces«.

Don’t know if the SoloType fonts are non-condensed, though.
